SEARCH
Module com.snake
Package com.snake

Class SpriteModel

java.lang.Object
com.snake.SpriteModel
public class SpriteModel extends Object
Stores sprite data and performs sprite logic - Based on GameUtil, ImageUtil, Snake, Food
Author:
Maxim Carr - Modified

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    follow(int multiplier)
    Makes snake body sprites follow the one in front of them, the head if it's the first part of the body, this makes the method handle cornering by having the current sprite 'latch on' to a position 25 px behind the previous one based on direction of travel.

    randomFruitGen()
    Returns a random number between 0 and 17 to be used in spawnFruit to pick a random food image

    randomScreenPositionX()
    Returns a random X position on the screen between 99 and 699 pixels

    randomScreenPositionY()
    Returns a random Y position on the screen between 99 and 499 pixels

    render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
    Draws sprite on Canvas
    void
    rotateByDegree(int newDegree)
    Changes Sprite and sprite image direction by a number of degrees calculated by subtracting the current direction (-90 = left, 0 = up, 90 = right, 180 = down) from the desired direction (-90 = left, 0 = up, 90 = right, 180 = down)
    void
    segmentSetup()
    Sets the position of the new segment of the snake's body to be behind the preceding one (snake-body.png is 25 pixels across) based on preceding sprite's direction of travel
    private void
    setBoundary()
    Sets image bounds for collisions

    Sets sprite direction

    Sets current position of the sprite as an X,Y coordinate

    setStored(double x, double y, double vx, double vy, int deg)
    Sets stored position of sprite just in case the user presses pause
    void
    setVel(int vX, int vY)
    Sets current velocity of the sprite as an X,Y vector
    void
    spawnFruit(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
    Renders a fruit sprite on screen with a random picture at a random position within the bounds of randomScreenPositionX, randomScreenPositionY
    void
    spawnSnakeHead(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
    Renders snake head on screen at a set position and sets its direction to face right, towards the centre of the screen
    void
    spawnWall(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
    Spawns a wall at random position and random direction, away from snake head to stop instant game over
    void
    updatePosition(double time)
    Updates sprite position on screen, only used with moving sprites.

  • Method Details

    • setStored

      public void setStored(double x, double y, double vx, double vy, int deg)
      Sets stored position of sprite just in case the user presses pause
      Parameters:
      x - double - X position of sprite
      y - double - Y position of sprite
      vx - double - X velocity of sprite
      vy - double - Y velocity of sprite
      deg - integer - Current direction of sprite

    • getStoredX

      public double getStoredX()
      Gets stored X position - used for pausing and un-pausing game
      Returns:
      double - Stored X position of Sprite

    • getStoredY

      public double getStoredY()
      Gets stored Y position - used for pausing and un-pausing game
      Returns:
      double - Stored Y position of Sprite

      double - Stored X velocity of Sprite

      Gets stored Y velocity - used for pausing and un-pausing game
      Returns:
      double - Stored Y velocity of Sprite

      public int getStoredDir()
      Gets stored X velocity - used for pausing and un-pausing game

      integer - Stored direction

      y - double - Y position of Sprite

      public void setVel(int vX, int vY)
      Sets current velocity of the sprite as an X,Y vector
      Parameters:
      vX - double - X velocity of Sprite
      vY - double - Y velocity of Sprite

    • getVelX

      public int getVelX()
      Gets current X velocity of sprite
      Returns:

    • getVelY

      public int getVelY()
      Gets current Y velocity of sprite
      Returns:
      double - Current Y velocity of sprite

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition(double time)
      Updates sprite position on screen, only used with moving sprites.
      Parameters:
      time - double - inter-frame elapsed time

    • follow

      public void follow(int multiplier)
      Makes snake body sprites follow the one in front of them, the head if it's the first part of the body, this makes the method handle cornering by having the current sprite 'latch on' to a position 25 px behind the previous one based on direction of travel.
      Parameters:
      multiplier - integer - current level which is also snake speed modifier

    • segmentSetup

      public void segmentSetup()
      Sets the position of the new segment of the snake's body to be behind the preceding one (snake-body.png is 25 pixels across) based on preceding sprite's direction of travel

    • render

      public void render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
      Draws sprite on Canvas
      Parameters:
      graphicsContext - GraphicsContext - context in which the Sprite is drawn

    • setBoundary

      private void setBoundary()
      Sets image bounds for collisions

    • getBoundary

      private javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getBoundary()
      Returns sprite boundary for collision check
      Returns:
      Rectangle2D - Has a property getIntersects() that allows program to see if a collision has occurred

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(SpriteModel sprite)
      Shorter way of writing intersection check in LevelController, used for detecting collisions
      Parameters:
      sprite - Sprite - current sprite
      Returns:
      boolean - has a collision occurred?

    • setCurrentDegree

      public void setCurrentDegree(int deg)
      Sets sprite direction
      Parameters:
      deg - integer - Desired sprite direction

    • getCurrentDegree

      public int getCurrentDegree()
      Returns sprite direction
      Returns:
      integer - The direction the sprite is heading

    • setFollowing

      public void setFollowing(SpriteModel prev)
      Sets which body part this sprite has to follow
      Parameters:
      prev - Sprite - preceding snake segment

    • getFollowing

      public SpriteModel getFollowing()
      Gets the preceding sprite in the snake's body, which is the one this is following
      Returns:
      Sprite - the sprite this Sprite is following

    • rotateByDegree

      public void rotateByDegree(int newDegree)
      Changes Sprite and sprite image direction by a number of degrees calculated by subtracting the current direction (-90 = left, 0 = up, 90 = right, 180 = down) from the desired direction (-90 = left, 0 = up, 90 = right, 180 = down)
      Parameters:
      newDegree - integer - The direction to turn the sprite to (-90 = left, 0 = up, 90 = right, 180 = down)

    • randomFruitGen

      private int randomFruitGen()
      Returns a random number between 0 and 17 to be used in spawnFruit to pick a random food image
      Returns:
      integer - random integer between 0 and 17

    • randomScreenPositionX

      private int randomScreenPositionX()
      Returns a random X position on the screen between 99 and 699 pixels
      Returns:
      integer - random X position between 99 and 699

    • randomScreenPositionY

      public int randomScreenPositionY()
      Returns a random Y position on the screen between 99 and 499 pixels
      Returns:
      integer - random Y position between 99 and 499

    • spawnWall

      public void spawnWall(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
      Spawns a wall at random position and random direction, away from snake head to stop instant game over
      Parameters:
      graphicsContext - GraphicsContext - the context to spawn wall into

    • spawnFruit

      public void spawnFruit(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
      Renders a fruit sprite on screen with a random picture at a random position within the bounds of randomScreenPositionX, randomScreenPositionY
      Parameters:
      graphicsContext - GraphicsContext - the level's graphics context used to spawn fruit into

    • spawnSnakeHead

      public void spawnSnakeHead(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext)
      Renders snake head on screen at a set position and sets its direction to face right, towards the centre of the screen
      Parameters:
      graphicsContext - GraphicsContext - the level's graphics context used to spawn snake head into
